website_summaries.verdict: A great choice for beginners, but it can't always match its competitors' performance.
pros: A must-have for the enthusiast seeking an acrobatic machine with precise hovering

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware of fire/smoke hazard
customer_reviews.text: After two days of usage, the battery overheated, burned the board up and now the product is useless. Be weary of the batteries that a supplied with these things and be prepared
customer_reviews.author: traveler

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner copter
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a cheap test quad copter. I didn't want to spend hundreds of dollars if I decided I didn't want to build them as a permanent hobby. This is a great copter. Extremely easy to fly. I would have happily paid a little more for this guy.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Oglesby

customer_reviews.title: Does not lives up to its brand name
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying different Drones and with Syma name attached to this little guy I thought that this drone will live up to its brand name. But alas I was wrong. Here are the Plus and Minus of this Drone: Plus: - The biggest Plus of this Drone is its cost. At 45$ you can at least have a Drone flying experience. Minus: - Really really hard to control and keeps drifting to one side. Tried recalibrating but to no use. - Battery lasts just a few minutes. - No Altitude hold feature. - Bad camera. - Bad remote design with display on the bottom of the remote rather than on the top, which makes it hard to see.
customer_reviews.author: Anuj

customer_reviews.title: Great drone for the price
customer_reviews.text: This drone is easy to fly, light weight, and will TAKE A BEATING! My child has crashed this thing into chairs, trees, the ceiling, the dog, and the ground from 45 feet up and it continues to work like a champ. The camera produces great quality shots. The batteries are a little short on life, but getting a few replacements means lots of flying time. I've been nothing but impressed with this little work horse. In fact, my other child received a defective one of these which we returned. We have been through two other drones as replacements. I finally re-purchased the Syma because of the durability and ease of control.
customer_reviews.author: RaH

customer_reviews.title: For the price, a great starter quadcopter
customer_reviews.text: As my first quadcopter, I'd definitely suggest this. Took me a little to get used to, but definitely alot of fun. Obviously, the more you pay for one the better features and small fine tuned it is. But I still have alot of fun with this. The prop guards definitely throw the stability off BIG time. Don't worry, you probably won't break them. I've crashed mine a few times and none of them broke at all. Check on amazon for extended batteries. It'll make your flight time more enjoyable. Takes it to about 10 mins on an upgraded 850mAh battery.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbob

customer_reviews.title: Great! robust! first drone!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first drone. I have to say the drone exceed my expectation in terms of robustness. It survived numerous crashes. I purchased couple of lipo battery, take the props, landing stand and camera. This thing fly like a charm and battery lasts really long once you take off all those stuff. I never really used the camera so I can't say anything for it. Since I crash this thing often I had to calibrate it often and then fine tune it. I mostly fly it indoor. So far it didn't break any of my stuff. This drone is so light i am not too worried about breaking things. I think this is a great drone for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Shiblee Sadik

customer_reviews.title: Syma X5C Still Works!
customer_reviews.text: We had one Syma X5C that was fine and worked well. Kids and neighbors loved it. Dad flew the Syma X5C over a corn field...first mistake. It traveled too far...second mistake. Landed in an unharvested corn field and could not be found...third mistake. Two more Syma X5C drones were ordered the same day that the one was lost. However, after the corn was harvested a few days later, the kids found the lost Syma X5C. It had been run over by a corn picker and was outdoors for a couple days. Had a couple bent rotors, but still works!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy extra batteries!! And extra light covers
customer_reviews.text: Great buy for the price it's very easy to learn how to fly and has great multi functions does awesome barrel rolls and flips in all directions only thing I suggest is buying extra batteries and light covers as 7 minutes battery isn't enough to enjoy it and the red light cover on left rotor pops off the have a pack of 4 light covers for 4.99 great buy to all in all I love this syma x5c and I'm gonna buy the syma t-9 and the syma x5s
customer_reviews.author: Alfred Young JR

customer_reviews.title: It was fun. Then it flew away.
customer_reviews.text: This drone was a ton of fun and it was surprisingly responsive and it had better than expected video quality. But, during a normal flight, it just kept climbing and climbing, it was responding to my controller inputs, its lights started flashing, and it flew off. I'm not so much angry as I am disappointed. I just wish it would have better control range. That simple issue is causing a lot of problems for a lot of people. But don't let this dissuade you from buying one... if you buy one, just keep it at a low altitude and it will probably work better. Unless it gets caught in an updraft. Then all bets are off.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: This thing can take a beating, but....
customer_reviews.text: So overall I really like this drone, and my kids do as well. My only complaints weren't very serious but I wanted to note them. Right out of the box the propeller guard deals that help keep the props from breaking when you crash it, interfered with two of the propellers so they would hit it. No big deal really but I always had to kinda bend it down a little before flying. The only other issue was the camera falling out sometimes, eventually it fell out and the little wire came out of the plug so I couldn't film anymore. Overall though, this thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: benjamin rose

customer_reviews.title: Toy Price : Remarkable Performance & Value : Great Starter Drone
customer_reviews.text: For the price, its amazing! A great practice drone before you go dropping you hard earned money in a more expensive system. I started out with an Android Phone drone flying App and then got this to get into the physical drone action again, having long ago gone in bigger on an original AR Drone. Its light enough that you do not need a special FAA registration to fly it as a toy. The video quality is mediocre, but amazing given the price. I removed the camera to give it better performance!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron K. Schwarz

customer_reviews.title: Pros and Cons
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Amazing price Perfect beginner flyer Very durable Comes with transmitter Good bright LEDS OK camera quality Comes with propeller guards Extra Propellers Cons: LED covers sometimes fall off Plastic quality kind of low
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer Mary

customer_reviews.title: Really fun to use, but camera is disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Really fun drone! My wife got this for me for Christmas last year and I was super excited because it was my first drone. It took a little while to get used to the flying but once i got the hang of it it was super fun. I always have to re-calibrate it each time I fly, which is a little annoying. The camera is not great. I got this hoping to add some cool aerial shots to my gopro videos but was really disappointed in the quality. It's cool to see the videos but I wouldnt get this to make videos. Get a drone with a better camera. Flight time was about 7 minutes or so for me.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hatch

customer_reviews.title: ... for my son last year for Christmas and he loved it. It's sturdy enough to withstand the shenanigans ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one for my son last year for Christmas and he loved it. It's sturdy enough to withstand the shenanigans of a 13 year old. He even got it stuck in a tree for a few days and when it came down finally with the assistance of a neighbor, it was still in tact and working. We liked it so much, I ordered another one this year for my nephew. The only downside is that it comes with 1 battery only that lasts for about 7 minutes of flying time. Definitely not enough fly time. I would rather they include more batters and bump the price up a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Me+Three

customer_reviews.title: Good teaching tool for newbies
customer_reviews.text: This is a great beginning drone. Don’t get me wrong, it SUCKS compared to anything from DJI, but I bought this to teach the concepts of quadcopter handling to newbies. For that it is perfect. It is tough, it had handled being flown straight into a pecan tree to falling from around 100 feet in the air, and just took right off once positioned right way up. You only get between 7 and 15 minutes of flight time, but it’s total lack of any sophistication lends itself to be a great teaching tool. For its price, it’s a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Great entry-level quad-copter
customer_reviews.text: For the money this thing is unbeatable. The camera is surprisingly high quality. Great entry-level quad-copter. Just do not fly this thing too high or you WILL lose it. It's very light and it's easy to get disoriented or carried off by the wind at high altitudes. However, it can survive falls from a distance surprisingly well.
customer_reviews.author: julian kallisti

customer_reviews.title: A great budget drone
customer_reviews.text: A great entry-level quadcopter! I researched a bunch of different ones and saw a lot of people recommending this one. I've been very satisfied with it and the camera quality is amazing for the price. The instruction book leaves a lot to be desired, but that's okay because you'll get the hang of it pretty fast. When you're starting out, be sure to use it in a wide open area so that it doesn't fall into somebody's yard. Also, because each battery gives you less than 10 minutes of flight time, you'll want to get some extra batteries and a multi-battery charger. I'm using Keenstone batteries and a Quadpro charger and I've been happy with them both.
customer_reviews.author: Anony mouse

customer_reviews.title: great starter drone!  Few tips...
customer_reviews.text: great little practice drone, battery life is short 10 mins and you should buy a second set of batteries video is crappy but watchable, but for the price very good. i highly suggest you DONT PUT THOSE GUARDS ON...if you are flying near trees. those bumper guards will get SNAG and get caught in the tree branches very easily!! if i didnt have those things on, i wouldve gotten out of the tree easily. Also if you fly too high you will start losing control, IMMEDIATELY CUTOFF THE THROTTLE, that will have it fall slowly, then you can restart the throttle and get back into range, otherwise it will start to fly on its own!
customer_reviews.author: warren g

customer_reviews.title: came missing a part and mostly cannot be used, it's going in the trash eventually.
customer_reviews.text: mine arrived missing a screw for one of the blade protectors which means it will not fly straight. I am experimenting with putting tiny pieces of tape on that arm to balance the unit out but so far all it does is fly towards the side of the missing screw. I guess the balance of this gyro is very very critical to be able to fly it at all. I dont think trim can fix the weight imbalance and the screw is too tiny to find at the local hardware store, it's a little bigger than one in your glasses hinges.
customer_reviews.author: G. Matot

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Cannot say enough good things about this little machine. My first quad so I was rough on it at first. I highly recommend getting different color rotors for the front. Since this is not headless, it will lessen the learning curve a bit. The parts are dirt cheap and after more than 400 hundred flights with the more powerful batteries, I had to replace a motor. Easy to do and they happened to come with the spare rotors and guards I ordered on Amazon. The parts and Syma X 5C-1 are worth the money and I am addicted. I fly every morning, weather and wife permitting.
customer_reviews.author: litewerx

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son. I flew it one time (Ive flown drones for many years) and after charging battery , it failed to work. Used another battery and charger, stilll wouldn't work, Problem was with the drone itself. I would stay away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Fully Manual. Like driving a stick-shift car. No flappy paddles, DSG or auto here.
customer_reviews.text: A really nice drone. For the price you don't get anything fancy but it's great as a starter as it forces you to be acquainted with all aspects of controlling a drone as this is a pure "manual" - no altitiude control, no come back when battery weak, no auto return, no autoland etc. You have to adjust throttle continuously and because there's no headless mode, you need to be able to think & visualize what the drone will do based on your controls. Very challenging. Parts are cheap too
customer_reviews.author: Rayhann Chee

customer_reviews.title: Very much dislike.
customer_reviews.text: We got them delivered Yesterday and just had them picked up to be returned. As soon as we got them we opened one to checl them out before putting them away for christmas and they are terrible looking. The picture looks like the item but having it in your hand and looking I have never been so disappointed in an item. I've never made an amazon return until today so that says alot. We will be buying a better quality after we get our refund.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: The Best Impulse Purchase I've Made!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product when it was on the Amazon Treasure Truck. I will admit it was a mostly impulse purchase, although I had been considering getting one for some time. Absolutely no regrets for buying!! love this quadcopter! It it highly durable and I have found that the battery life is better than advertised in the manual (granted I have not used the camera while flying yet). It takes some practice to get moving and I would advise using outside until you have mastered it a bit. I have crashed it many times and has virtually no damage (my last one broke after 48 hours...) and I've already had this a few months. Great for teens and older!
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Perfect first drone
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect drone to learn to fly with. Don't bother with the "fancier" versions that Syma offers - they're still just toys so they won't provide the professional quality you'll eventually desire. If you want those features, just save up for a professional drone and keep practicing with this basic X5C-1 in the meantime. Once you've mastered this one, you'll be ready to fly a more expensive "real" drone. And if you happen to crash or lose this one as you're honing your skills, you won't be too upset.
customer_reviews.author: G.B.

customer_reviews.title: We were impressed with how sturdy it is
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 13 yr old son's birthday. He loves it. The only big problem we had was it did not come with instructions. My son searched on line and found them in minutes (the scan code on the box only produced Chinese instructions). Once we knew which button controlled High/Low it was much easier to fly. The controls are very sensitive and on high my son pressed lightly and the thing shot upward and off behind some trees. It crashed hard in front of the house on the street behind us. We were impressed with how sturdy it is. There was not a scratch on it after falling 50 ft.
customer_reviews.author: S Lyons.

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Lasted about 3 flights - very touchy - unstable unless absolutely still with no air movement. one rotor stopped working after less than 25 min TOTAL fly time for no apparent reason. Would NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Judd Clarence

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my dad cause I knew he'd love it and he did ! He took it outside right away , he's still getting the hang of flying it around but he said it's really good and he said once he gets the hang of flying it he'll start to use the camera on it , I was excited myself getting it , the price was good & it's good guality and good size . My mom bought him a tile mate key finder in case it gets lost in the woods near their home . Overall good buy & I absolutely reccomend it .
customer_reviews.author: Min

customer_reviews.title: Awesome entry level quad!
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome entry level quad! Durable and loads of fun! When doing video, it does take quite a bit of coordination to have it pointed in the right direction, buy hey, it is like I said, entry level. The video is actually quite good, though as others have said, pretty much outdoor only, as it doesn't do well in low light. Maybe because I'm a novice at this, I did find that it's too hard for me to fly in anything over @5mph wind. However, when it's calm out, it does great! This little guy has me hooked and will be looking to step up to one of the "big boys" in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: J. K. Miliunas

customer_reviews.title: No micro SD card for camera nor size it manual.
customer_reviews.text: received drone on time. Easy to fly. Really like this drone for beginners. The only negative is it did not come with a Micro SD card for the camera. There was an adapter for the SD card to USB but no card its self. The manual does not say what type to use with the camera. I had a 32gb but it does not work. I have ordered a 4gb micro SD in hopes that it is the right one. If this does not work I will be returning the drone. I will keep you posted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Drone For Anybody!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Drone! I recommend it to any drone enthusiast or beginner. I bought a drone about 2 years ago, and soon after one of the propellers stopped turning keeping it from flying, so I bought this one and It works perfectly! No complaints. It's great for a beginner, or a drone expert. the features it has are the following, 360 eversion, picture AND video by the press of a button on the controller, Great quality pictures, High/Low speed mode, and an over 250 foot range. If you want to fly it longer though buy the extra batteries for it. Link to batteries =>.
customer_reviews.author: A. Stahlman

customer_reviews.title: This drone is great fun for kids and adults!
customer_reviews.text: This drone is great! The controller is a little bulky and the controls a little touchy. but once you get used to it, it is great! i bought this for my 10 year old son and he absolutely loves it. We opened the package and found that you can buy mulitiple battery replacements at a great price. This is a great drone for starting out. I figure I can let him get used to controlling something like this and then when he is a little older, invest is something with a better camera!. This item was shipped quickly and packaged well. This drone is great fun for kids and adults!
customer_reviews.author: Jayme G

customer_reviews.title: no experience needed.
customer_reviews.text: this is the first RC flying thing I could actually control. No experience and right out of the box. The controls can be set less sensitive for the beginning flyer. I have flown strait into walls and the ground with no damage. Keep it away from the wife's head though. It wont survive if she gets a hold of it after you crash it into her after repeated warnings to be careful. I was being careful. it didn't take any skill to hit a target that large though. it does come with extra blades just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Jon A

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a couple weeks
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a couple weeks, now it looses connection randomly and sticks with your last remote command. I.E. On take off I gave full throttle. From 10 feet away my remote lost connection and my drone went up, up, up, and away.... It came down in my neighbors yard so I got it back. This thing is durable if nothing else and image quality is decent, amazing for the price I'd say, but the connection issue is a big deal. It's fun for a while, but I'm on the fence about recommending it. I am not super happy with it, but I also don't not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyler

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Fun at Cheap Price - Not a Toy
customer_reviews.text: Ready to fly right out of the box. This is not a toy that will break after a few flights. Easy for a beginner to fly yet challenging for a more advanced drone pilot. Comes with memory card battery even a a screwdriver. Add your own AA batteries for the transmitter. With the blade guards attached (recommended), it can withstand most bumps and crashes. Two modes - high and low sensitivity. LCD screen showing trim points. Camera mode is not his res as advertised but still works well enough. I gave them away for new clients at a trade show. The quad is on top of the boxes with it's lights flashing. Great attention getter!
customer_reviews.author: Gmaz

customer_reviews.title: Gray gift for all ages and easy to learn
customer_reviews.text: My 65 year old mom wanted one of these for Christmas because she lives on a farm and thought it would be fun. I spent a lot of time looking for a good sturdy one for amateurs and Thai one fit the bill. It was easy enough for me and her to figure out and she really enjoys taking pictures above her land. The pics are good and clear. My only complaint is a short fly time (about 7-10 minutes but this seems pretty average for the amateur modes. Great for a gift of all afes
customer_reviews.author: Nichol P

customer_reviews.title: Good useless fun......like life itself
customer_reviews.text: This thing is perfect for learning to fly. It's cheap, easy to control and you can crash it into the fridge, the cat, the wall and it will just keep on getting back up. Just like Rocky himself.... I like this thing for flying in the house to stay in practice. I have a Mavic Pro 2 Zoom and it's not as house friendly. Buy one for yourself and one for your favorite neighbor.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M. Harper

customer_reviews.title: but it was easy to setup the return and get a new one
customer_reviews.text: The first one wouldn't sync with the transmitter, but it was easy to setup the return and get a new one. They even cross-shipped so I got the replacement in two days. The replacement is working great. This is my first quad so I'm no expert but everything is as I expected from reading the reviews. The camera is grainy in low light but very clear when there's plenty of light. Controlling a quad isn't easy but I have no complaints about the stability and responsiveness of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Morris

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: I'm definitely no expert but this was fairly difficult to fly. The father away it gets, the longer the signal delay. Of course I crashed it a few times, nothing major. But one hard landing that was far softer than some of my other crashes, made some sort of connection come loose in one of the motors. I've crashed others far harder many times over, so this was a bit of a surprise. This wouldn't be bad for someone to tinker with I suppose. I did not get the camera to work either, but have up after only a few minutes of our bit working because I was frustrated at that poin .
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for first time pilot or younger person.
customer_reviews.text: Look, I run the local FPV Meetup, we race quadcopters and such along with the larger video platform drones. When asked what a new pilot that is not sure if they want to really get into the hobby or not should get, I always say Syma X5C-1 this is the best starter quad you can get. There are a few mods to do to get even better range and use but, this is the perfect start. Is low price and gental low rate ability make it perfect to learn on.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Best $50 I have ever spent....
customer_reviews.text: I just received my Syma x5c two days ago. It has already fallen 150 feet out of the sky. Been lodged in 6 trees and taken paint off of my living room ceiling in 5 spots. This thing is indestructible! Make sure to get the extra batteries and blades pack. You will need them if you are new to drone flying like me. The camera does a great job capturing video in the daytime. It does not have night vision and is not top of the line high Def quality. It's fifty bucks. I just read the manual after 2 hours of playing with it and found out how to do front, side and back flips. This thing is great.
customer_reviews.author: Marya Braun

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little drone to learn with. Great inexpensive drone which flies superbly and is crazy durable. I've crashed this thing countless times and haven't even needed to change a blade. I also crashed it over water on a houseboat trip and it was 15 feet underwater for about 10 minutes. I thought we'd lost it until diving and seeing the lights were STILL FLASHING underwater. We retrieved it, and it was flying like new in the morning. The video is nothing to be dazzled by with its low resolution, but it's a fantastic first drone to get the hang of flying and getting some interesting video or stills. You cannot go wrong with this quadcopter.
customer_reviews.author: SuperNovaTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: and the camera captures nice footage considering the price
customer_reviews.text: This is an impressive amount of tech for around fifty bucks. The copter is imminently stable and flyable, and the camera captures nice footage considering the price. While probably a standard feature in quadcopters of this class, the removable battery is much appreciated after owning several copters with non-replaceable batteries that die prematurely. The copter is sturdy enough and is still in good working order after quite a few flights and a couple of less-than-graceful landings. The sometimes poorly-translated manual and the trim knob arbitrarily re-purposed as camera control button attest to the sacrifices that need to be made to meet the price point, but all in all this is a fun and worthwhile toy.
customer_reviews.author: Aron Nopanen

customer_reviews.title: Camera not functional
customer_reviews.text: Drone works nicely, the camera not so much. There appears to be a short in the cable. The camera only activates from the remote if I'm applying pressure to the wires coming from the camera to the drone. So I have to start a video while applying pressure, fly it, land it, then apply pressure to stop the video. Impossible to take pictures in the air with this issue. I'll upgrade this review if I can have someone from the company get in touch with me to send out a replacement camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Cadez

customer_reviews.title: Solid Product for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for fun to pass the time after hours while working in USA. I have flown RC choppers before, and that cost me a fortune in repair costs as the flight of a chopper is similar to a pendulum motion. Have to say that this little unit is damn robust. I have been flying it in the hotel room with several clashes with the ceiling, walls and other obstacles. This little unit takes the pummeling pretty well and just carries on. The video works fine, and as more than adequate. If they could put a return/land/takeoff feature it would have 5 stars I think. Otherwise good training quad.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Increased the ranged
customer_reviews.text: The antenna protruding from the controller is misleading. The actual antenna in the controller is a half inch long. I clipped it off and soldered a 2.4ghz antenna i pulled off an old wireless router. The range increased so much.....i had it at least 300ft up, and the wind took it...i tried to fly it back but once it is a quarter mile away you cant tell if its coming or going. I could see it responding to my controlls....I lost line of sight over a national forest. The loss os my fault. Beware of seeminly unlimited range if you replace the antenna. Still, it was a 5 star flight to me
customer_reviews.author: Army MP

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 10 minutes!
customer_reviews.text: Against my wishes, my husband decided to fly this right outside our home and within 10 minutes, had it stuck in a tree. We tried our best to get it out of the tree but my husband basicly had to climb the tree and knock it out. The batteries lasted the entire time, but the machine won't fly anymore. I have ordered a bunch of new gears and new motors and my husband will have to rebuild it and hopefully avoid trees next time. He's on his own if he trees it again. This gets four stars because it worked really well for the whole 10 minutes before it got stuck. Never even tried out the camera. lol
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Z

customer_reviews.title: Should come with spair parts for repair it breaks fast.
customer_reviews.text: I find it to be good my grandson loved it but already it broke but the part that broke is repairable but still he broke it one week of getting it.
customer_reviews.author: Casilda Perez

customer_reviews.title: Great to learn on!
customer_reviews.text: Great for the money. Easy to fly right out of the box, although I have yet to get it to hover in one place very well. It always seems to drift slowly in one direction or another (inside house). I took it outside and was impressed by how well it flew and the height easily achieved. I was afraid the wind could take it from me so tried to control myself. I'm sure with more practice it will be very easy to master this thing. Very happy with this purchase and excited to keep learning. I've also dropped this thing mid flight when about to hit a branch or power lines and it has held up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Top Dawg

customer_reviews.title: best yet.
customer_reviews.text: best drone ive bought to date! 20hrs in replaced one motor with aftermarket no big deal. Camera works however some devices do not like the format. However this drone barebones can FLY! i would buy again (u can get a full replacement no tech knowledge needed for 26$) and not the mention the ease of buying parts! overall best drone ive bought yet. For around 75$ i got 6 upgrade batteries the drone and 2 sets of parts. dont waste ur money on a different entry level drone. Only complaint i have is the range is a bit to be desired and thats about it.
customer_reviews.author: Ani

customer_reviews.title: keep an eye on your distance from your from your drone to your remote
customer_reviews.text: Here's what I'm saying very good product Amazon is true to their word they look out for their customers I think the product is outstanding I've had a couple small issues but I think they probably were air from me and not the machine I would recommend this drone to a friends-and-family and family. So those who get this product I think we'll be cool to be happy and I say that if you have any problems call on Amazon they will take care of you thank you Amazon thank Syma the makers of the drone.
customer_reviews.author: Rowdy

customer_reviews.title: Get these and feed those trees!
customer_reviews.text: Loved the drone but lost the first one when it flew out of range and got lost in trees, looked for days and still haven't found it. Will wait until fall when leaves drop and look again. TREES LOVE TO EAT THESE. I would HIGHLY recommend putting reflective tape or at least painting it neon orange because when it hits tree it is almost impossible to see. Get extra batteries also. The drone is very well made and durable. Camera is like an 2000 era web cam but it is still a blast to fly high and take video/pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Dyer

customer_reviews.title: Nice quadcopter for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Given the cost, I was surprisingly impressed at the quality of the quadcopter. The battery life holds up decently well under fall/summer temperatures, decreases when exposed to winter weather. That is expected given the batteries are Li-ion based, but I think is something that should be taken in consideration when using the quadcopter. Nice speed, holds up well to slight crash landings which speaks well to the mechanical strength of the plastic frame and blades.
customer_reviews.author: Adam P.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Haulin' Oats this thing does.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cool drone. Video and photos aren't anything special or even that good, but I didn't expect greatness. I just wanted to be able to document my ridiculous piloting. As for the actual quad, well, it's a fast and fun drone to fly. I wanted to get better before I move up to the next level and this was the perfect choice. I've had it since Christmas and it hasn't been destroyed, nor does it show any trauma. I'd say this is great for beginner to intermediate level pilots who want to just have fun and not worry about breaking the bank if anything happens.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Max

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The copter control and stability are good and I've taken some pictures and video that is very good for this caliber of toy. I modified the battery compartment by snipping off the lower battery support; that makes it a lot easier to place and connect the battery. I can also fit a larger battery capacity for longer flight time. It does tend to climb away from me requiring that I almost stop the rotors to loose some altitude. This copter is incredibly lightweight, but handles a breeze just fine. I can land it precisely on a 2' circle. Fun to play with. I haven't tested the radio range yet.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Heim

customer_reviews.title: Fun starter drone
customer_reviews.text: This is my first drone purchase. I went cheap so I could get a feel for flying and not worry about losing/crashing it. I've crashed it quite a few times (trees, etc.), but it's still going strong. It is very light, so be careful if it's windy outside. I almost lost it completely when the wind carried it into a tree on my first flight. Overall, it's definitely been a fun purchase and I've learned a lot. I would recommend this to anyone looking to get a feel for drone flying.
customer_reviews.author: JBS

customer_reviews.title: he seemed to really like it. It was a last minute Christmas Gift ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for $69.95 and the next day it was listed for $49.95. Amazon corrected this right away and will be refunding me the $20 difference so I'm extremely impressed with Amazon's customer service. My husband is a lefty so it was a little hard for him to control at first but once he got the hang of it, he seemed to really like it. It was a last minute Christmas Gift and I didn't want anything too expensive and this fit the bill perfectly. IT DOES NOT NEED TO BE REGISTERED which I find important. Be sure to check the registry when shopping for a drone as many of them do need to be registered before use.
customer_reviews.author: Junebugwen

customer_reviews.title: well that sucked, the second it started it just went up
customer_reviews.text: well that sucked, the second it started it just went up, and up and up, wouldn't stop going up, went into sun and disappeared, lost it. My daughter who I got it for is about half as upset as I am. How can they make it so it only goes up? I get calibration and fine tuning, but when it wont stop going up even when full down there is a problem waste of money and got to upset my daughter..
customer_reviews.author: Chris Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Best value!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to drones but have had many hilos so this was very easy to fly. The only problem was seeing what direction you were headed in daylight. Easy fix, painted the blade guards. Buy extra batteries also, because you will just want to keep flying!!!
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Capinjola

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This quadcopter is awesome! It takes a little time to really get the controls mastered but once you do this will be your new weekend addiction! The picture and video quality was much better than expected and I would recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Jonny Robertz

customer_reviews.title: Fun but Fragile Flying
customer_reviews.text: Cool product with promise. But the instructions are poorly translated into English, and I had to pull hard at various parts to assemble it when it wasn't clear if that was the necessary move or would destroy the product. Fortunately, I guessed correctly. Pull the battery cover off with some strength but gently. Also hard to control, but that might take time. NOTE: Try flying this the first time away from any trees or tall objects!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dov M. Wasserman

customer_reviews.title: Best Copter for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this copter. It is truly my favorite flying device. The stability is awesome and the camera is pretty good too. I'm not a stunt flyer, so flipping the copter has not been done by me, but my younger brother loves flipping it. I recently took this copter back east to show my family and the next day, my father and brother went out and bought copters. They didn't purchase this one, but they all agreed that mine was easier to fly. Needless to say, my youngest brother purchased the exact same one and he's having a ball with his.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H.

customer_reviews.title: You'll have a blast with it
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about this drone. I'm not a tech guy at all by no means so if I can fly it and keep from tearing it up it means something. It,s easy to operate,easy to sync up, great drone to learn on. It,s pretty tough I've bumped it into a few limbs, chased my dogs and one of them caught it and blade it didn't even scratch him, the drone didn't break, prop didn't even get messed up. Now the camera is a little grainy but better than I thought it would be for the price. I don't like giving 5 stars for anything but this drone is right there. You'll have a blast with it
customer_reviews.author: Jpsavoy

customer_reviews.title: ... was a gift for my kids and they have loved it. It has taken a lot of crashed ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my kids and they have loved it. It has taken a lot of crashed landings without breaking. It doesn't stay charged as long as I like but we still loved this drone for my kids.
customer_reviews.author: kp9230

customer_reviews.title: The drone is awesome!!! and you DO NOT need to register this drone.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of these drones as a present for the kids and am not disappointed in the least. They have survived several rough landings as well as a fall from about 30 feet up, after dislodging itself from a tree. As for the registration here is what Ive found, which states that this model is excluded from the upcoming FAA drone registration based on weight.
customer_reviews.author: Pierre

customer_reviews.title: Love flying
customer_reviews.text: My first quadcopter. Took a couple of days to get used to the controls but now i'm pretty good with it. I use for fun flying and not really interested in videos. I suggest changing controller to mode 2 putting forward/backward and yaw control both on the right joystick. I rarely use the camera and find the copter flies better with cam and landing skids removed. Also longer flight times with cam removed. I'm getting almost 10 min flights on single batt. Copter without cam only weighs 3 oz so is well under the limit required for registration.
customer_reviews.author: Florian

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves his. We were very surprised with the photo quality. It's not like hd quality but for the price and as small as it is it's pretty decent. UPDATE: Go with a more expensive model. After about 2 weeks one of the blades wouldn't spin. Got a replacement and when we received the replacement the remote wouldn't turn on at all. Just sent it back. Don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Ann

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: For the money it seems to good to be true. Used it for 2 weeks and was very happy. Minor issue would have been light covers fell off within first few minutes. Flew fine, took decent pics and videos. However, the last time I used it, it went off on its own. It just kept climbing even though I had the joystick stick down. Eventually it went so high i lost sight of it and could never find it again. Even though it malfunctioned I still feel for the price it's not a terrible purchase.
customer_reviews.author: K Slimp

customer_reviews.title: EHHH - It's OK
customer_reviews.text: It says "one button flip" really two but pretty easy Key point says "7 minutes of flight time" - I have not been able to get more than five before I loose stability. None of the pictures ended up being what I was pointing at. Clear pictures but pointing is ambiguous and mostly a matter of chance Getting the micro SD card out is a real trick - bring tweezers. Hover is OK but takes some trimming. After two minutes you have to trim again. Once the battery wears down - trim changes a lot. Height control is still 'old-school' It over-reacts - both up and down. I was not impressed for the money charged
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Ronald C. Markham

customer_reviews.title: I am so glad I bought this quad copter instead of the high-end ...
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I bought this quad copter instead of the high-end DJI Phantom copter. The Syma is my first drone and I learned a great deal about them in a very short time. Unfortunately, my son came over and flew it straight up about 150 ft and we watched a strong gust of wind blow it about ten houses down into a high tree. Arrrggghhhh! Oh well, at least it was only fifty bucks. Maybe the next one I buy I will have more fun and hide it from my son. Dollar for dollar, this is the best drone FOR THE PRICE and a great learner. Parts are available too. Have fun.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Belanger

customer_reviews.title: Not the Drone for you
customer_reviews.text: I'm an avid drone flyer and I must say that this is one of the worst quadcopters I have encountered. Amazon wouldn't refund my money, Don't buy good price bad product
customer_reviews.author: Chester howell

customer_reviews.title: Great for amateur enthusiasts
customer_reviews.text: We're not hard core RC connoisseurs, and we haven't tried the camera yet, but this is a really fun gadget to have. The controls are pretty easy to grasp and the flips are pretty cool. It is very lightweight, so wind has a big effect on it, but ours has taken a few pretty spectacular spills and is holding up well. It would be nice if it had a greater tendency to land upright and it's a little hard to tell what direction it's facing in daylight. The lights are great at night. Remember to register your drone with the FAA!
customer_reviews.author: steel_muffinsTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Really good for a beginner to learn how to fly.
customer_reviews.text: Really good for a beginner and fun to fly. Gets you used to the controls and is honestly a blast to fly around the house. In my experience it’s pretty durable. Smashed into walls, trees, pets, kids, grandparents, fine china, and other drones without issue. This might be one of the most purely fun products I’ve ever bought on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great indoor/outdoor copter for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Great indoor/outdoor copter for beginners. It can take a while to learn so be careful when you fly it indoors. This product is very light so if you do fly it outdoors, be careful not to fly it in windy or even breezy conditions. The control on this thing is amazing, I was able to fly it through my house after I learned to control it. The instructions are clear and you can learn how to do a 360 degree flip in any direction.
customer_reviews.author: Moshabeer H.

customer_reviews.title: Very fun
customer_reviews.text: My husband got one of these as a present, then it took off in the wind and when the battery died it dropped into the woods. Never to be seen again. So we got a second one and he still has it and enjoys it tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: What A Sweet Life!

customer_reviews.title: The video is decent and gives a good quality picture
customer_reviews.text: The picture does not do the X5C justice it comes with Prop protectors and an extra set of 4 props! The video is decent and gives a good quality picture... I wasn't expecting a Hollywood pic clarity either.. we were looking for a starter quad just to quench our appetite as to what all the fuss is all about when it comes to drones... OMG it has opened a brave new world... the X5C is just a toy but it teaches fundamentals that have real world applications.... we are hooked and will continue to expand our drone knowledge who knows we may just bump into a new business!
customer_reviews.author: Luis Hernandez Mencia

customer_reviews.title: 3 Years And Going Strong
customer_reviews.text: After 3 years, this little drone is still going strong! It was my first drone that I bought to practice on since it was such a great price, so I didn’t have to worry too much about breaking it. Little did I know that it held up so well. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Drone!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for Christmas. One for my husband and one for my 10-year-old son. They have had a complete blast with them. The camera works great and really shoots nice pictures. The charge time is a little long for the flight time you get, but I just ordered extra batteries so they can play longer. I have heard from both of them that there was a learning curve when flying them for the first time. It didn't take long though for them to figure it out. Of course, the 10-year-old figured it out faster than the adult...gotta be the video games. I would recommend these as a great toy for a first-time drone enthusiast.
customer_reviews.author: QltrGrl

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Can't say that this is of the greatest quality but given that most quality drones start at ten times the cost of this one, I suppose I shouldn't be surprised. We have used this over soft grass fields each time we have flown. Most of the time, our time flying is spent trying more to keep it from crashing rather than actually flying. And seeing as how crashing is seemingly inevitable, having it be more sturdy would be nice. I have used quite a bit of super glue putting this back together repeatedly.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Sager

customer_reviews.title: Great but SD slot messed up.
customer_reviews.text: It worked great but the camera slot for the sd card was messed up. We took several pictures and videos. Took out the SD card and when returning it, it wouldn’t go back in. Will increase stars if they refund my money. **update. Money was refunded. Overall it was a nice drone and it’s good for the amount. My son really enjoyed it and it navigated easy. If only the SD card slot didn’t mess up.
customer_reviews.author: Mom Prime

customer_reviews.title: Great to learn on, but do not push it
customer_reviews.text: Fun little toy, but you get what you pay for. Lasted a week with heavy usage. Control is simple to learn but hard to master. Replaced motors, which isnt hard if you can solder. Remember to keep track of screws if you are doing repairs. Remember to replace batteries in transmitter too, or you'll lose signal if it goes too high, and WILL NOT be able to control descent. Remember that this is a toy, and that it can break easily if used outside around hard surfaces. One fall from 30 feet onto concrete and it's done for. Play with it inside, or around soft surfaces with little wind while outside.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J Foley

customer_reviews.title: Dream Drone
customer_reviews.text: Dream Drone for learning how to fly this type of craft.. Mode 1 handles well for beginners, allowing for the unavoidable learning curve that will consist of multiple crashes. Rebounds well from even high altitudes drops and has a semi-auto rotate action that slows the impact with the ground. Camera takes decent pictures and videos. On a clear day and at the right altitude I've captured images of mountains and buildings that are 10-20 miles away. One curious thing is that Dragon Fly and Bumble Bee's are attracted to it in flight and almost seem to 'play' with it as it buzzes through the air.
customer_reviews.author: T. Timmins

customer_reviews.title: Recipient has practiced with it (he's had similar remote control vehicles) and was very pleased. Bought the replacement propelle
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly, gave as a gift. Recipient has practiced with it (he's had similar remote control vehicles) and was very pleased. Bought the replacement propellers also, which he has already replaced. As a beginners drone he was impressed.
customer_reviews.author: C. M-R

customer_reviews.title: Undoubtedly one of best beginner drones on the market for under $50
customer_reviews.text: Undoubtedly one of best beginner drones on the market for under $50! Very stable flight characteristics. Outdoor flying was possible after only 2 days of indoor practice with the control transmitter. Flight time is somewhat brief (6-8 minutes) so ordering extra batteries and charger is a must. I bought this drone as a trainer before graduating to a DJI Phantom but will probably fly this drone on a regular basis anyway. Camera quality (still photos and video) are good quality considering this little drone does not have a gimble. Transmitter range meets the new FAA LOS requirements of 450 feet with excellent signal control.
customer_reviews.author: KnifeBunny

customer_reviews.title: A definite must buy for new pilots and great fun for experienced ones.
customer_reviews.text: I had to take a moment and write a review for this drone. I learned to fly with this quad and have had it for a year now. I've crashed it dozens of times and it keeps going. It flies GREAT (except in the wind of course). The flip option it is great too. If you are new to drones this is the one you want. And, if you are an experienced drone pilot this will be like the old friend that you enjoyo being with.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drone for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Excellent drone for the price. Had to order a second one because we lost the first one in some trees. The best thing to do is get used to all the controls, hovering no more than 6 feet, to get a hang of it for awhile. Also, label all of the controls with a label maker or marker, so you don't forget which button or lever is which. Video quality is not bad at all. I've flown it about 30 times so far and it never disappoints.
customer_reviews.author: B. Loomis

customer_reviews.title: I suppose for the price it's pretty good. Instructions are understandable
customer_reviews.text: Ok. This is my first quad copter. I suppose for the price it's pretty good. Instructions are understandable. The poor Chinese person who wrote them I think really tried to make a good set. It's just ok. The battery lasts about six or eight minutes of solid off and on flying. It would be best to buy a few extras. Sometimes it has a hard time pairing with the controller. It gets up quick and is a cool toy though. My eight year old boy works it over and doesn't have any trouble. I don't know about the cameras capabilities because I haven't downloaded pictures. I bought it mostly just to fly I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: flan

customer_reviews.title: and COINCIDENTALLY someone else gave him a drone as well (even though I had been planning and saying I was going to buy him this
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my brother, and COINCIDENTALLY someone else gave him a drone as well (even though I had been planning and saying I was going to buy him this for like a month, apparently, she "forgot"). Anyways, he looooved it and flies it around all the time, has 2 modes, one is for sort of softer flying and another for more drastic flying. The camera footage isn't to die for but it's probably as good as a digital camera you would buy like 5-10 years back; as in the quality is still pretty decent. All in all, 5 star!
customer_reviews.author: bananaramadingdong

customer_reviews.title: Absolute BEST budget/beginner quad on the market, hands down.
customer_reviews.text: Best bang for your buck quad on the market, IMO. I received the X5C-1 version, as others have noted... where the flip is the top right shoulder button and the camera is operated with the trim button on the left stick. Flies great, an excellent beginner quad. Camera quality is better than I expected. Obviously, in low light/indoors it's pretty awful, but outside in the daylight it provides some surprisingly good video. It's not production quality video, by any means, but it's excellent for just playing around and getting some aerial views. Again, best budget/beginner friendly quad out there, period.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: ... few hours that this drone worked it was very good, but it only worked for a few hours ...
customer_reviews.text: In the few hours that this drone worked it was very good, but it only worked for a few hours then just completely stopped working. It didn't crash and we never ran it into anything. It just stopped working. It got tossed around in the wind easily. Fortunately we were able to return it to Amazon using Prime and we got our money back.
customer_reviews.author: Georgann Krakowiecki

customer_reviews.title: poorly made
customer_reviews.text: Well, I bought 2 of these for my grandsons for christmas. It's a huge disappointment when a 8 year Olds toy gift doesn't work on Christmas day- it happens. Well we since have ordered some heavy duties batteries, and they ran great ! Then an hour later one of the propellers quit! Needless to say a drone needs all propellers running to work. Waste of money and then more money , but more than the money it's the dissapointment of my grand babys is what matters most.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy C Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner drone
customer_reviews.text: Great drone for beginners to learn on. It’s stable, easy to control and easy to fly. The camera quality is OK and the video was all right, nothing special but the camera and video is not what I bought it for. It’s a great drone to learn on for the price before you invest in something expensive like a DJI.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Fun to Price Ratio is Through the Roof...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first RC aerial vehicle. I have had a chance to fly it outside several times and also indoors too. Waiting on the additional batteries to come in so I can practice for up to about 1/2 hour at a time. Took a few minutes to figure out how to tune it. Pictures and video work. I went ahead and ordered a parts replacement kit that included the motors so if something breaks... Pros Price, Price, Price. For the money, ya cant beat it. Flies smooth, responds well. Cons The quad is light, so flying in the wind is not what you want to do.
customer_reviews.author: OverACliff

customer_reviews.title: Fly away with a crappy camera
customer_reviews.text: Had a fly away. Took it about 30 feet up and tried to spin around. It started to spin and then went full power and up. Managed to get throttle cut but it turned back on and flew away. Also camera is about as good as the first smart phones. I would recommend another cheap quad. Was fairly robust as I flew it at least a dozen times and crashed a good number of them with no real problems.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Awesome until it stopped working after just a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: This thing was super great, especially for the price. After just a handful of flights however, there appears to be a short where the battery connects to the machine. The drone will not stay powered up unless I'm constantly putting pressure on that connection, which I obviously can't do while flying it. I bought 5 new batteries, same story. So now I have a drone that I can't use.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Olsen

customer_reviews.title: so I guess that means it's easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I'm shocked at how long this thing has lasted considering it's being used by a 9 year old. Has definitely taken a beating. Haven't even had to use the replacement propeller yet. He hooked the whole thing up to the computer on his own, so I guess that means it's easy to use. It takes a good picture. Definitely worth it. I shopped around a lot before picking this one.
customer_reviews.author: 1orangetabbycat

customer_reviews.title: Great midsize flyer at very good price
customer_reviews.text: Great midsize flyer at very good price. I would give it 5 stars if the camera lens could be focused. The lens is glued and focused to about 2 feet, and it should be focused for 5' to infinity. So the movies and the pictures are little blury despite having 720 resolution. I own 2 of these quadcopters and they have the same problem. The construction and durability is great. Also get yourself extra batteries and charger ! The 7-8 min flightime is reasonable, but you probably don't want to wait an hour + for another flight. Enjoy and be carefull around other people.
customer_reviews.author: Dundee

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my hubby and he has been having a good time with it. Easy to use right out of the box, I purchased extra batteries so no issue with length of flight time. Has had multiple bumps into furniture / floor with no problem. The blade guards do a good job of taking the brunt of the hits. He had gotten the hang of controlling it after only a couple of uses. Great product for great price. Highly recommend as "first drone".
customer_reviews.author: D. DawsonTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: The toy is awesome. It responds well to the controller
customer_reviews.text: The toy is awesome. It responds well to the controller. I used it to check my new roof that the roofers put on last week. I used the video camera to record the job that they did on the 3rd story of my house without clinbing a ladder. I was able to find mistakes that they made and showed the video to the owner of the business. He liked that I was able to show him his guys quality of work. The video has great quality. Just by analyzing my roof and having the roofers fix thier mistakes, this product has paid for itself. I WANT ANOTHER ONE!
customer_reviews.author: Budziszek

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended! Like anything new you'll need some time to ...
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended! Like anything new you'll need some time to get used to flying a drone. This is the perfect quadcopter to learn with as it is easy to fly and extremely durable. I've crashed it dozens of times from grass, boulders, trees, hardwood floors, tile floors the list goes on. Each time with no damage that puts the quadcopter out of commission. It came with extra blades that I haven't had to use yet. The picture and video quality is pretty decent given the overall price and quality of this drone. The only drawback is you're probably going to get the bug and want to get more drones.
customer_reviews.author: A. Martins

product_meta.title: Syma X5C 4 Channel 2.4GHz RC Explorers Quad Copter w/ Camera
product_meta.description: Main Features: 6-axis Gyro stabilization system makes the helicopter more stable and flexible when flying. Wind resistant and can be flown indoors or outdoors Modular design structure is applied, more simple for assembly and convenient for maintenance 360 degree Eversion and throwing flight function. Equipped with HD Camera Left / Right hand throttle mode can be changeable by the transmitter (2 in 1) Includes: 1 x Syma X5C RC Quad Copter 1 x 2.4G Remote Controller (does not include 1.5v AA batteries) 1 x USB charging cable 4 x Rotating blade 4 x Protection frames 2 x Landing skids 1 x Screwdriver 1 x 3.7V 500mAh LiPO battery 1 x User Manual.
feature_bullets: A key 360o roll, continuous roll for perfect action and wonderful performance.
Build-in 6 axis gyroscope for precise hovering in the sky

Using spread spectrum technology for further remote distance, best anti-interference ability, least power consumption. you could fly more helicopters at the same time, its reaction speed is 100 times faster than other radio control
Various control options for those piloting the X5 Up, Down, Left, Right, Forward, Backward, Leftward flight, Rightward flight.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars5,778 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
